samples.context: Chlamydomonas, Paramoecium and bacteria. These organisms are called unicellular organisms (uni = single). On the other hand, many cells group together in a single body and assume different functions in it to form various body parts in multicellular organisms (multi = many) such as some fungi, plants and animals.
samples.question: What are examples of unicellular organisms?

samples.context: Every multicellular organism has come from a single cell. How? Cells divide to produce cells of their own kind. All cells thus come from pre-existing cells.
samples.question: How do multicellular organisms develop from a single cell?

samples.context: On the other hand, many cells group together in a single body and assume different functions in it to form various body parts in multicellular organisms (multi = many) such as some fungi, plants and animals.
samples.question: What is characteristic of multicellular organisms?

samples.question: What does 'uni' mean in unicellular organisms?

samples.question: What is the source of all cells?
